name: Chris Fermüller
content:
Chris Fermüller

ao. Prof., Dipl.Ing. Dr.techn.

| Theory and Logic Room: HB 0316 Tel: +43 1 58801 18543 Fax: +43 1 58801 18597 Available: Monday, 11.00-12.30 (during lecture period, if not announced otherwise below) Mail: chrisf@logic.at Function: Associate Professor Office Hours: Monday, 11.00-12.30, only during lecture period, otherwise by appointment via email. Note: Please contact me by email: chrisf@logic.at Teaching I am regularly in charge of the following courses: Theoretische Informatik und Logik (VU) (jointly with Marion Oswald) Logic and Computability (Lectures with integrated exercise part) Nonclassical Logics (Lectures with integrated exercise part) Seminar in Artificial Intelligence Seminar in Logic Formal Semantics of Natural Language (I also participate in a number of other courses) Documents, Publications, Links The Logic Algebra and Truth Degrees (LATD) conference 2023 Some of my publications (DB&LP Bibliography Server). A more complete (but hardly ever up-to-date) list of my scientific publications in [PDF format] SPECIFICALLY: For selected publications on logical games and connections to proof theory click here Lecture slides on 'Games and Analytic Systems' from a short course at the Sommer School for Proof Theory in First-Order Logic in Funchal, Madeira, 22.-27.08.2017: Part I, Part II I am a fan of Bob Brandom's approach to logic. However, I think there is a deep trouble with one of Brandom's central claims about `holistic, yet recursive semantics'. I'd be glad to receive comments on a corresponding paper: Some Critical Remarks on Incompatibility Semantics (appeared in: The Logica Yearbook 2009, College Publications 2010).
